content.description: Stem, chimney, and face climb between two columns to reach the top of this surprisingly fun jaunt. You're going to lichen it!
content.protection: .2 - 1 cams, nuts, and ball nuts if you got em'
content.location: Work your way into the gulley between the two columns. It shares an anchor with Dear in the Headlights.

content.description: A fun and challenging traverse route; try to boulder from one end of the crag to the other (about 300 feet from end to end). Some sections are easy while others are blank and difficult to get through. No boulder pads, partner, or fancy equipment needed... just climbing shoes and some chalk. If you were to peel off, it's a pretty safe and grassy landing zone for most of the traverse, but be careful near occasional metal posts and ground rocks. This traverse has bouldering heights that range anywhere from an inch off the ground to 5 feet up. Beware the harmless Orb-weaver spiders and their webs at certain times of the year!

Follow two cracks up to a small, speedbump-esque, bulge, and then lie-back, stem, jam, and smear your rubber into the beautiful twin cracks streaking to the top. The upper sequence is fantastic and takes great gear.
content.location: Walk past Roadkill and Redhead Dreams, the route is just around the corner. The route is north facing if you're looking to hide from the sun!

content.description: Fun route using Cams and Stoppers. Strong hand holds with a little bit of stemming. Similar to a lot of the area, a lot of the feet can be hidden while viewing from below. Belaying in the grass is comfortable!
content.protection: Stoppers and Cams to 2". Bolt station at top.
content.location: First route from the pullout. Rings at the top can be seen easily from the bottom.

content.description: Short and sweet. Follow the obvious crack.
content.protection: Stoppers and cams to 2". Bolted station at top.

climbs.name: The red head of my dreams

content.description: Start beneath a small roof and smear/stem up to the undercling. Make a powerful move up and over onto good holds and good feet. Progress upward finding small palcements for a few meters. The Crux comes just after stepping left onto new columns above a roof. Make a very big move with two good holds and awful feet, and then pull through to worse holds and tiny feet. Move back right and head to the anchors.
content.protection: A single BD #2, then very small cams and stoppers. Multiples of the smallest stoppers or C3's or Ballnutz are needed.
content.location: To the immediate right of Roadkill, beginning below two column-roofs. See beta photo "Roadkill routes".

content.description: Start up some broken pillar formations to a system of small cracks up the main face of the climb.
content.protection: Gear up to a BD #1 and one key BD #3 placement low on route. Rest of route ranges from small to mid-range. #1 & #2 ball-nutz are handy.
content.location: Farthest route to the right at Roadkill Crag. Adjacent to Skidmarks.

content.description: Route climbs the left hand side of prominent double columns shared with Roadkill. Protection goes in thin crack between columns. Step left at top to bolted anchor station.
content.location: Top anchors between Hitchhiker and Roadkill.

content.description:
Don’t pick

up hitchhikers lest they steal your proj ;).  Good finger locks to a fun sequence of balancy tips locks with decent feet most of the way.  Crux comes towards the top right before the jugs as the feet go away.  Protects well with cams .2-1 and small offset nuts.
content.protection: Small cams and nuts. Bolt station at top.

climbs.name: Deer in the Headlights
climbs.fa: Cleaned by Jake Wilson, freed by Zach Lentsch

content.description: Easier climbing off the ground leads  to committing moves on good holds above small gear.  Crux comes just below mid height.  The seam opens up again and the climbing eases off a bit toward the top.  Not too hard but you might want to think about it a bit so you don’t end up staring into the high beams!
content.protection: Small offset nuts and cams to .75 plus one #3.
content.location: Two climbs left of Skidmarks, shares anchors with the 5.9+/10- immediately to the right.
